content: @Sandra Vance - is there a link for the breakout rooms? I searched this stream and confluence, but I couldn't find anything. I do see the links for the rooms in Whova.
Here is the link for Connectathon Break out Room Sign up. Viet - please note i have alrerady scheduled the Da Vinci Track highlights.
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Break-Outs

@Sandra Vance -- IIRC, in Connectathon 24, track leads could create their own breakout rooms (within the Zoom meeting they host). Does that not work in Connectathon 25? Do we need to pre-register all the breakout rooms above? And if so, how will people be assigned into them?
hello Chris. In the trail above Sandy mentioned this link https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Break-Outs you can schedule your sessions from there.
I was just asking if that is the only way to do it. In the past Connectathon, pre-registration of breakout rooms was not required. I'm just wondering how it all works...

that is the only way to do it for this connectathon. She changed how it was managed this time around. I believe it was partially because that information in the breakout rooms could not be recorded and shared later.
OK. Got it. Thank you!

@Sandra Vance @Mary Ann Boyle Could we get more breakout rooms set up? CDC has booked 14 of the available 20 hours of the schedule for one of the rooms. I added a column for Breakout Room number, since it's not indicated on the schedule.
Hold on. There's a limit (of two at a time) on breakout rooms? If so, that is a bit of an issue, because I need one at 10am, noon, 2pm, and 4pm each day!
Hey @Chris Moesel How many attendees are you expecting? I should be able to set you up with a secondary Zoom account for the purpose.

I think the instructions should be put at the top of the page. It's not clear. The AMA scheduled blocks of time. Is HL7 creating separate breakout/zoom sessions for each request? or are we sharing 2 or more zoom rooms like we would physical rooms at a connectathon? I removed the column I added for room numbers to avoid confusion and awaiting the answer to the questions above. Thanks,

Thanks, @Bryn Evans. It's hard to know for sure... We didn't have any sort of pre-registration or anything and the breakout sessions might appeal to folks who are participating in other tracks too. What happens if I guess wrong?
@Chris Moesel thinking about it now, nothing. Let me get confirmation from management on how we're managing this and I'll get back to you.

@Viet Nguyen Sandy wanted it to be shared like the F2F meetings. I think we need Sandy to let us know if Hl7 should open up more space, or just use the 2. @Sandra Vance Can you please let Bryn and I know how you wish for us to handle this request
@Mary Ann Boyle - That was my understanding as well. We certainly need more rooms if we allow the CDC and AMA to use large blocks.

Thanks. We had unlimited breakouts in the last Connectathon and planned assuming that was still the case. In short, we have developed some FHIR Shorthand educational sessions we want to provide to track participants. We have 4 different topics, offering each on Thursday and each on Friday.
But not all participants will want to join each one, so we wanted to keep the main track room for typical ad-hoc track stuff.
@Chris Moesel I completely understand. @Sandra Vance is managing this event so we just need to make sure she is on board, but I think we can make this happen as long as Sandy is good with it

@Chris Moesel - Sandy explained that there's a distinction between a breakout that launches from an existing zoom meeting - the track lead can do that but needs to manage it. That's akin to a sidebar conversation at a physical connectathon table. The breakout rooms are more like the physical breakout rooms at the in-person connectathons, where the track may want to discuss a specific topic separate from testing and may be of interest to participants in other tracks. @Sandra Vance @Mary Ann Boyle can clarify if I misstated the understanding.
Is there a difference between breakouts and what shows up as "subsessions" in Whova?
EG: I would love to officially have times on my agenda for the kickoffs and wrap ups (like daVinci)... but not sure how to do that or if that's something all track leads can do
(and I don't see how to edit my track either... in app or on website)
@Bryn Evans can help you @Jenni Syed to update your track session
@Sandra Vance can help you get the times for the breakouts @Jenni Syed
I don't really want breakouts... I just want more detail to be in my session for things like kickof and wrap up. Wasn't sure if subsession == breakout?
@Chris Moesel are you planning anything before the track start @9am ET tomorrow?
@David Hay -- nope. Mark posted the track schedule in #shorthand here. By tomorrow the breakout educational sessions will be listed in the Whova app.
